title: How to retire a time period record
content:
Note  

  • You must have the appropriate permissions to be able to retire a time period.
  • If you retire a time period, it no longer displays in Service Management modules. For example, a retired time period doesn't appear in the Change Calendar.
  • On call shift is a special type of time period, once an on-call shift is activated, its state will always stay Active. That is, it cannot be moved forward to Retired or back to Draft. 

To retire a time period record means changing its status, as shown in the workflow snapshot at the top of the time period, from active to retired.

  1. From the main menu, select Plan > Time Period.
  2. Select the time period record.
  3. Click the record identifier in the ID column to display the selected record.
  4. Click , then Save.
